title: Great Britain's men finish fifth at World Championships
text:
Great Britain’s men came in fifth at the World Championships team event in Stuttgart, where Russia claimed the gold in the most dramatic of finales.

After the British women had taken sixth place on Tuesday, this was a respectable finish, even if a couple of marks went astray through uncharacteristic errors.

Giarnni Regini-Moran sat down during his floor routine after under-rotating on a tumble, while double Olympic gold medallist Max Whitlock suffered a fall on the pommel horse. The other members of the team - James Hall, Joe Fraser and Dom Cunningham - all scored consistently as Great Britain totalled 251.611. They did not seriously threaten to pick up a medal, because bronze medallists Japan were around six-and-a-half marks ahead – a huge margin in this format.

The USA’s men, who are never as competitive as their women, finished fourth on 254.578. The event reached a memorable conclusion as China’s Sun Wei fell on the high bar when victory seemed to be within his team’s grasp.

Afterwards, James Hall – who is the team’s most dependable allrounder and performed on all six pieces of apparatus – told the BBC that he had never enjoyed a competition so much, despite not picking up a medal. He will go again on Friday in the men’s all around.
description: Great Britain’s men came in fifth at the World Championships team event in Stuttgart, where Russia claimed the gold in the most dramatic of finales.
